words.definition: To appeal to someone is to be interesting or enjoyable.
words.example: The idea of a vacation appeals to me.

words.definition: To assume is to think that something is true.
words.example: I assumed you were tired, so I left you alone.

words.definition: To borrow is to take something for a short time.
words.example: Can I borrow your pen for a minute?

words.definition: A client is a person who pays for a service.
words.example: The lawyer has many clients.

words.definition: Downtown is the center of a city.
words.example: We went downtown to do some shopping.

words.definition: If something is dull, it is not interesting.
words.example: The movie was so dull that I fell asleep.

words.definition: To embarrass someone is to make them feel silly or shy.
words.example: He embarrassed me in front of my friends.

words.definition: A fare is the money you pay to travel.
words.example: How much is the bus fare to the city?

words.definition: Former means happening in the past.
words.example: He is a former president of the company.

words.definition: A formula is a set of instructions to get a result.
words.example: I followed the formula to solve the math problem.

words.definition: To found something is to start it.
words.example: They founded the school many years ago.

words.definition: To invest is to put money into something for a profit.
words.example: He invested his money in a new business.

words.definition: A loan is the money that you borrow.
words.example: I got a loan from the bank to buy a car.

words.definition: If something is practical, it is useful.
words.example: He gave me some practical advice.

words.definition: A quarter is one of four equal parts.
words.example: It's a quarter past four.

words.definition: A salary is the money you get for your job.
words.example: He gets a good salary at his new job.

words.definition: A scholarship is money for school given to a student.
words.example: She won a scholarship to a top university.

words.definition: If something is temporary, it lasts for a short time.
words.example: I have a temporary job for the summer.

words.definition: Treasure is a collection of valuable things.
words.example: They found a box of buried treasure.

words.definition: To urge is to try to make someone do something.
words.example: He urged me to study harder.
